Class Board

java.lang.Object
engine.forBoard.Board
public final class Board extends Object
The Board class represents a chess board containing 64 tiles and chess pieces. It provides methods for creating and maintaining the chess board state, managing pieces and players, and calculating legal moves. The board keeps track of white and black pieces, the current player, en passant opportunities, and the transition move that created the current state.

This class is immutable - after creation, the board state cannot be modified. Instead, moves create new Board instances with updated states.

Author:
Aaron Ho, dareTo81

  • Field Details

    • boardConfig

      private final Map<Integer,Piece> boardConfig
      A map representing the configuration of pieces on the board. The keys are tile coordinates, and the values are the corresponding pieces.

    • whitePieces

      private final Collection<Piece> whitePieces
      A collection of white pieces currently present on the board.

    • blackPieces

      private final Collection<Piece> blackPieces
      A collection of black pieces currently present on the board.

    • whitePlayer

      private final WhitePlayer whitePlayer
      The player controlling the white pieces on the board.

    • blackPlayer

      private final BlackPlayer blackPlayer
      The player controlling the black pieces on the board.

    • currentPlayer

      public final Player currentPlayer
      The player whose turn it currently is to make a move.

    • enPassantPawn

      private final Pawn enPassantPawn
      The pawn that is susceptible to en passant capture in the current position. Null if no en passant opportunity exists.

    • transitionMove

      private final Move transitionMove
      The move that resulted in the current board position. Returns a null move if this is the initial board position.

    • zobristHash

      private final long zobristHash
      The Zobrist hash value for this board position, used for position identification.

    • STANDARD_BOARD

      private static final Board STANDARD_BOARD
      A pre-constructed standard chess board configuration representing the starting position. This is a constant instance shared across all instances of the Board class.

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the board, showing the piece configuration. The board is displayed as an 8x8 grid with pieces or empty spaces.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the board.

    • prettyPrint

      private static String prettyPrint(Piece piece)
      Converts a piece to a string representation for display. White pieces are displayed as uppercase letters, black pieces as lowercase. A dash represents empty tiles.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to convert to string.
      Returns:
      The string representation of the piece.

    • getBlackPieces

      public Collection<Piece> getBlackPieces()
      Returns a collection of black pieces currently on the board.
      Returns:
      A collection of black pieces.

    • getWhitePieces

      public Collection<Piece> getWhitePieces()
      Returns a collection of white pieces currently on the board.
      Returns:
      A collection of white pieces.

    • getAllPieces

      public Collection<Piece> getAllPieces()
      Returns a collection of all pieces on the board, both white and black.
      Returns:
      A collection of all pieces on the board.

    • getAllLegalMoves

      public Collection<Move> getAllLegalMoves()
      Returns a collection of all legal moves that can be made by both players on the current board.
      Returns:
      A collection of all legal moves.

    • whitePlayer

      public WhitePlayer whitePlayer()
      Retrieves the white player controlling the white pieces.
      Returns:
      The white player.

      public BlackPlayer blackPlayer()
      Retrieves the black player controlling the black pieces.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(int coordinate)
      Retrieves the piece at the specified coordinate on the board.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - The coordinate to check (0-63).
      Returns:
      The piece at the specified coordinate, or null if the tile is empty.

    • getEnPassantPawn

      public Pawn getEnPassantPawn()
      Retrieves the pawn susceptible to en passant capture, if any.
      Returns:
      The en passant pawn, or null if no pawn is susceptible.

    • getTransitionMove

      public Move getTransitionMove()
      Retrieves the move that led to the current board state.
      Returns:
      The transition move, or a null move if no transition occurred.

    • getZobristHash

      public long getZobristHash()
      Gets the Zobrist hash value for this board position. This hash is used for efficient position identification and transposition table lookups.
      Returns:
      The 64-bit Zobrist hash.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code for this board, using the Zobrist hash value.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      The hash code.

    • createStandardBoard

      public static Board createStandardBoard()
      Returns a standard chess board configuration representing the starting position. This method uses a cached instance for better performance.
      Returns:
      A standard chess board with pieces in their initial positions.

    • createStandardBoardImpl

      private static Board createStandardBoardImpl()
      Creates and returns a standard chess board configuration with all pieces in their initial positions.
      Returns:
      A new Board instance with the standard starting positions of pieces.

    • calculateLegalMoves

      private Collection<Move> calculateLegalMoves(Collection<Piece> pieces)
      Calculates the legal moves for a collection of pieces on the board.
      Parameters:
      pieces - The collection of pieces for which to calculate legal moves.
      Returns:
      A collection of legal moves for the given pieces.

    • calculateActivePieces

      private Collection<Piece> calculateActivePieces(Board.Builder builder, Alliance alliance)
      Calculates and returns the active pieces of a specified alliance on the board.
      Parameters:
      builder - The builder containing the board configurations.
      alliance - The alliance (color) of the pieces to be considered.
      Returns:
      A collection of active pieces belonging to the specified alliance.
